text: Incidence of Chronic Kidney Disease and Its Risk Factors, Results of Over 10 Year Follow Up in an Iranian Cohort Maryam Tohidi1, Mitra Hasheminia1, Reza Mohebi1, Davood Khalili1, Farhad Hosseinpanah2, Babak Yazdani1, Amir Ahmad Nasiri3, Fereidoun Azizi4, Farzad Hadaegh1 1PreventionofMetabolicDisordersResearchCenter, ResearchInstituteforEndocrineSciences, ShahidBeheshtiUniversityofMedicalSciences, Tehran, Iran, 2Obesity ResearchCenter, ResearchInstituteforEndocrineSciences, ShahidBeheshtiUniversityofMedicalSciences, Tehran, Iran, 3DepartmentofNephrology, MasihDaneshvari Hospital, ShahidBeheshtiUniversityofMedicalSciences, Tehran, Iran, 4EndocrineResearchCenter, ResearchInstituteforEndocrineSciences, ShahidBeheshtiUniversity ofMedicalSciences, Tehran, Iran Abstract To examine, the predictors of incident chronic Kidney disease (chronic kidney disease) in a community-based cohort of Middle East population, during a mean follow-up of 9. 9 years. In a sample of 3313 non-chronic kidney disease Iranian adults 20 years the estimated glomerularfiltrationrate(estimated glomerular filtration rate)wascalculatedatbaselineandatthreeyearintervalsduringthreeconsecutivephases. The estimated glomerular filtration rate, 60 milliliters per minute/1. 73 m2 was defined as chronic kidney disease. Multivariate Logistic regression analysis was used to determine the independentvariablesassociatedwithincidentCKD. TheincidencedensityratesofCKDwere285. 3and132. 6per10, 000 person-year, amongwomenandmen, respectively. FemalegenderpersewasassociatedwithhigherriskofCKD, compared with males. Among women, age, estimated glomerular filtration rate, known Diabetes, being single or divorced/widowed, hypertension (marginally significant)andcurrentsmokingwereindependentriskfactorsforCKD; howevertheintermediatedegreeofeducationand familyhistoryofdiabetesdecreasedtheriskby40%(P, 0. 05). Amongmalesubjects, independentpredictorsofdeveloping chronic kidney disease included aging and hypertension (with significantly higher risk than in women, P for interaction, 0. 05), estimated glomerular filtration rate, new diagnosed Diabetes, High normal Blood Hypertension; abdominal obesity decreased the risk of chronic kidney disease about 30% which was marginally significant. In the Iranian population, . 2% of individuals develops chronic kidney disease each year. Our findings confirmed that sexspecific riskpredictors shouldbeconsidered in primary preventionforincident chronic kidney disease.
